ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.

taskDescription: For a fundraiser at school, the Robotics Club is selling bags of apples and bunches of bananas during lunch. They will make a profit of $4 per bag of apples and $6 per bunch of bananas. Due to school health regulations, the club is allowed to have only 20 bags and bunches of fruit on school grounds each day to sell. Another regulation: the container where the Robotics Club keeps the fruit has a maximum weight capacity of 70 pounds. Each bag of apples weighs 3 pounds, while each bunch of bananas weighs 5 pounds. Write the inequalities that represent these constraints. Then summarize the equations that represent this system.
detailedSolution:
The constraints are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>≤<!-- ≤ --></mo>
  <mn>20</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a + b \leq 20</annotation></semantics></math>
and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>≤<!-- ≤ --></mo>
  <mn>70</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3a + 5b \leq 70</annotation></semantics></math>.
The summary is: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>4</mn>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mn>6</mn>
  <mi>b</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P = 4a + 6b</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>≤<!-- ≤ --></mo>
  <mn>20</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a + b \leq 20</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>≤<!-- ≤ --></mo>
  <mn>70</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3a + 5b \leq 70</annotation></semantics></math>.
